question: A 31-year-old female is experiencing an acute asthma attack. She is conscious and alert, but in obvious respiratory distress. After assisting her with her prescribed MDI, you should:
answers: check the drug's expiration date to ensure that it is still current.
contact medical control and apprise him or her of what you did.
administer another treatment in 30 seconds if she is still in distress.
reassess the patient and document her response to the medication.
correctAnswers: reassess the patient and document her response to the medication.
selectedAnswer: reassess the patient and document her response to the medication.
title: Chapter 12- Principles of Pharmacology

question: After taking diphenhydramine (Benadryl) for an allergic reaction, a person begins experiencing drowsiness and a dry mouth. These findings are an example of a(n):
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: A medication with antagonistic properties is one that:
answers: enhances the effects of another medication when given in a higher dose.
produces a cumulative effect when mixed with the same type of medication.
stimulates receptor sites and allows other chemicals to attach to them.
blocks receptor sites and prevents other chemicals from attaching to them.
correctAnswers: blocks receptor sites and prevents other chemicals from attaching to them.
selectedAnswer: blocks receptor sites and prevents other chemicals from attaching to them.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Aspirin is beneficial to patients suspected of having a heart attack because it:
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: EMTs arrive at the scene of a patient who was "found down." A family member states that she gave naloxone (Narcan) to the patient before the ambulance arrived. The EMTs should suspect that the patient:
answers: has a low blood glucose level.
has a history of allergic reactions.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: How is nitroglycerin usually given by the EMT?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The process by which medications travel through body tissues until they reach the bloodstream is called:
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: What medication form does oral glucose come in?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: When administering naloxone (Narcan) via the intranasal route, the EMT should administer:
answers: at least 2 mL into each nostril.
a half dose into each nostril.
correctAnswers: a half dose into each nostril.
selectedAnswer: at least 2 mL into each nostril.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: When assessing an elderly male who complains of nausea and generalized weakness, you find that he takes atorvastatin (Lipitor) and amlodipine (Norvasc). These medications suggest a history of:
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following clinical signs would necessitate the administration of naloxone (Narcan) in a suspected narcotic overdose?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following is an example of a rules-based medication error?
answers: The EMT administers a drug that is not approved by the medical director.
The EMT administers a drug that is contraindicated for the patient.
The EMT administers the correct drug, but gives it by the wrong route.
The EMT accidentally gives a higher drug dose than what is indicated.
correctAnswers: The EMT administers a drug that is not approved by the medical director.
selectedAnswer: The EMT administers a drug that is not approved by the medical director.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of epinephrine?
answers: Secreted naturally by the adrenal glands
Decreases heart rate and blood pressure
correctAnswers: Decreases heart rate and blood pressure
selectedAnswer: Decreases heart rate and blood pressure
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following is the MOST rapidly acting medication administration route?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following medication routes delivers a drug through the skin over an extended period of time, such as a nitroglycerin or fentanyl patch?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following statements regarding glucose is correct?
answers: Glucose is given to patients who are suspected of being hyperglycemic.
Glucose is usually administered by the EMT via the intravenous route.
Glucose is a complex sugar that rapidly absorbs into the bloodstream.
Glucose is a simple sugar that is readily absorbed by the cells.
correctAnswers: Glucose is a simple sugar that is readily absorbed by the cells.
selectedAnswer: Glucose is a simple sugar that is readily absorbed by the cells.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following statements regarding the epinephrine auto-injector is correct?
answers: The auto-injector delivers epinephrine via the subcutaneous route.
EMTs do not need physician authorization to use the auto-injector.
The adult auto-injector delivers 0.5 to 1 mg of epinephrine.
The epinephrine auto-injector delivers a preset amount of the drug.
correctAnswers: The epinephrine auto-injector delivers a preset amount of the drug.
selectedAnswer: The epinephrine auto-injector delivers a preset amount of the drug.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following statements regarding the metered-dose inhaler (MDI) is correct?
answers: Shaking an MDI prior to use will cause deactivation of the medication.
An MDI delivers the same amount of medication every time it is used.
MDIs are most commonly used by patients with cardiovascular disease.
MDIs are contraindicated for patients with asthma or emphysema.
correctAnswers: An MDI delivers the same amount of medication every time it is used.
selectedAnswer: An MDI delivers the same amount of medication every time it is used.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: You are dispatched to a movie theater for a 39-year-old female with signs and symptoms of a severe allergic reaction. As you are assessing her, she pulls an epinephrine auto-injector out of her purse and hands it to you. After confirming the drug's name and expiration date, you should:
answers: request an ALS ambulance to administer the drug.
ask her if she takes other medications.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: You are treating a middle-aged man with chest discomfort. He has a history of three previous heart attacks and takes nitroglycerin as needed for chest pain. You have standing orders to administer aspirin to patients with suspected cardiac-related chest pain or discomfort. While your partner is preparing to give oxygen to the patient, you should:
answers: confirm that the patient is not allergic to aspirin, give him the appropriate dose of aspirin, and document the time and dose given.
assist the patient in taking one of his prescribed nitroglycerins, assess his vital signs, and give him aspirin if he is still experiencing chest discomfort.
contact medical control, apprise him or her of the patient's chief complaint and vital signs, and request permission to give him aspirin.
ensure that the patient's systolic blood pressure is at least 100 mm Hg because aspirin dilates the blood vessels and can cause a drop in blood pressure.
correctAnswers: confirm that the patient is not allergic to aspirin, give him the appropriate dose of aspirin, and document the time and dose given.
selectedAnswer: confirm that the patient is not allergic to aspirin, give him the appropriate dose of aspirin, and document the time and dose given.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)
